instructions: Find all the apps that have admin privileges. This is the common way to list them, but the path you take to get there depends on your Android version : Security > Device admin apps Security & privacy > Device admin apps Security > Device Administrators Lock Screen and Security > Other Security Settings > Phone Administrators . Once you've accessed the list of device admin apps, disable admin rights by tapping the option to the right of the app. This will remove the check mark or toggle the button to the off position. Now you can delete the app normally . On some devices, you can tap the app right there in the admin apps list and then use the Uninstall app link to remove it immediately.
